metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Sends encrypted screenshots and keylogs to C2 https://www.cs.bu.edu/~goldbe/teaching/HW55815/presos/carbanak.pdf

Messages are encrypted using Microsoft’s implementation of RC2 in CBC mode with PKCS#5 padding. The encrypted message is then Base64 encoded, replacing all the ‘/’ and ‘+’ characters with the ‘.’ and ‘-’ characters, respectively. The eight-byte initialization vector (IV) is a randomly generated string consisting of upper and lower case alphabet characters. https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html

Binary is “Encrypted” by xoring with 0x9D https://www.cs.bu.edu/~goldbe/teaching/HW55815/presos/carbanak.pdf

 by Autor

metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Uses a custom binary protocol for C2 communications. https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html

The second method of C2, a custom TCP-based protocol
https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

If a message is larger than 150 bytes, it is compressed with an unidentified algorithm. If a message is larger than 4096 bytes, it is broken into compressed chunks. https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Using Mimikatz to get passwords from local and domain accounts
https://www.group-ib.com/resources/threat-research/Anunak_APT_against_financial_institutions.pdf
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Uses XOR with random keys for its communications
https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html

To communicate with its C2 server, Carbanak uses the HTTP protocol with
RC2+Base64 encryption, adding additional characters not included in Base64. https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

.doc, .rar or CPL files. Sometimes they were sent from compromised coworkers´ accounts. https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

Uso de cuentas legitimas para el envío de correos y también el envio de adjuntos con password
https://www.group-ib.com/resources/threat-research/Anunak_APT_against_financial_institutions.pdf

Correo con exploit RTF o un archivo .SCR. https://www.welivesecurity.com/la-es/2015/09/08/carbanak-nuevos-trucos/

The document contains an encoded VBScript. https://www.forcepoint.com/blog/x-labs/carbanak-group-uses-google-malware-command-and-control

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Sensitive bank documents have be found on the servers that were controlling Carbanak. 
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

Target credit card data by scraping memory on Point-of-Sale systems. https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https:/www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

Browser history and passwords, as well as RDP and share information 
https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf


 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Carbanak comments uses UTF-8 and code page 1251 (Cyrillic). 
https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2019/04/carbanak-week-part-one-a-rare-occurrence.html

MIME::Base64
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

Encrypt RSA, Encode RC2
#define BEG_ENCODE_STRING BS
#define END_ENCODE_STRING ES
https://github.com/Aekras1a/Updated-Carbanak-Source-with-Plugins by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

command killos Renders computer unbootable by wiping the MBR
https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html

the program “MBR Eraser” to remove traces and to crack Windows computers and servers. https://www.group-ib.com/resources/threat-research/Anunak_APT_against_financial_institutions.pdf by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Containing URLs linking to jRAT. https://www.proofpoint.com/sites/default/files/proofpoint-threat-insight-carbanak-group-en.pdf by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Queries the user’s default %TEMP% directory looking for the xname.txt file and uploads to the C2 server. 
https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf

Searches data from the log file named nsb.pos.client.log and C:\NSB\Coalition\Log https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https://www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

PJW to locate Windows API functions https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2019/04/carbanak-week-part-one-a-rare-occurrence.html

ON_CODE_STRING defined in the CARBANAK backdoor source code that when enabled: sandwich the strings to be encoded with the strings “BS” and “ES”. https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2019/04/carbanak-week-part-three-behind-the-backdoor.html

The malware author has pre-calculated the CRC hash of the API function. https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https://www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

The latest Carbanak samples are digitally signed. https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

Win32/Spy.Agent.ORM, Win32/Spy.Sekur y Win32/Wemosis estaban firmados digitalmente con el mismo certificado. https://www.welivesecurity.com/la-es/2015/09/08/carbanak-nuevos-trucos/

Numerous Spy.Sekur payloads have been signed using stolen or fraudulent certificates, and the NSIS signed with the same Time Doctor LLC and Tragon Corporation certificates.
https://www.proofpoint.com/sites/default/files/proofpoint-threat-insight-carbanak-group-en.pdf

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Port and VNC scanning https://www.group-ib.com/resources/threat-research/Anunak_APT_against_financial_institutions.pdf

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

%AllUsersProfile% + \Dropebox + <username> 
Saves the data to an XML file 
https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https:/www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

.bin files in the folder: .\All users\%AppData%\Mozilla\
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

Monitors for changes to logs stored in C:\NSB\Coalition\Logs and nsb.pos.client.log and sends parsed data to the C2 server
https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html

The file “9D01CA.txt” sent an initial fingerprint of the system compromised which contained the name of the antivirus solution installed on the system, the local IP address, username, computername and OS version.
https://www.bitdefender.com/files/News/CaseStudies/study/262/Bitdefender-WhitePaper-An-APT-Blueprint-Gaining-New-Visibility-into-Financial-Threats-interactive.pdf
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Turns off malware activity for a specified period of time.
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

After executing the command and exfiltrating the data, the malware sleeps for 3- 5 minutes. https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https:/www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/ by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

CVE-2012-2539, CVE-2012-0158. https://www.group-ib.com/resources/threat-research/Anunak_APT_against_financial_institutions.pdf

CVE2012-0158, CVE-2013-3906, CVE- 2014-1761 https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf    

CVE-2015-1770 https://www.welivesecurity.com/la-es/2015/09/08/carbanak-nuevos-trucos/

CVE-2017-8570, CVE-2017-11882, CVE-2018-0802. 
https://www.bitdefender.com/files/News/CaseStudies/study/262/Bitdefender-WhitePaper-An-APT-Blueprint-Gaining-New-Visibility-into-Financial-Threats-interactive.pdf

CVE-2015-2545, CVE-2015-1641
https://www.proofpoint.com/sites/default/files/proofpoint-threat-insight-carbanak-group-en.pdf
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

To enable connections to the infected computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

 by Autor

Outlook personal storage tables (PST) files within user directories https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Determines if either the avp.exe or avpui.exe processes is running for local privilege escalation.
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

CVE-2015-2426 https://www.welivesecurity.com/la-es/2015/09/08/carbanak-nuevos-trucos/

CVE 2013-3660, CVE 2013-5065, UACBypass, COM, CVE-2014-4113, BlackEnergy2, CVE-2010-4398
https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2019/04/carbanak-week-part-two-continuing-source-code-analysis.html
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Downloads and uploads commands and files. The commands are compared with a hash table.
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

Downloaded tools have included Nmap, FreeRDP, NCat, NPing, and others. el32.exe and el64.exe, kldconfig.exe, kldconfig.plug, and runmem.wi.exe, anunak_config 
https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https://www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/
 by Autor

Downloaded tools have included Nmap, FreeRDP, NCat, NPing, and others. el32.exe and el64.exe, kldconfig.exe, kldconfig.plug, and runmem.wi.exe, anunak_config 
https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https://www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/ by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Tinymet uses the single-byte XOR key 0x50 to decode the shellcode. https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2019/04/carbanak-week-part-three-behind-the-backdoor.html

Uses RtlDecompressBuffer to expand the compressed payload DLL. The malware moves the offset for the XOR key into RAX, then into a QWORD, and then onto the stack before it calls “runtime_ stringtoslicebyte” to decode the configuration https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf

The malware has a decoder table https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https://www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

Usando wincrypt.h
https://github.com/Aekras1a/Updated-Carbanak-Source-with-Plugins

“cyanbl 4.ADO” is decoded using the key GurnardScapularyHydrograph provided by the NSIS script https://www.proofpoint.com/sites/default/files/proofpoint-threat-insight-carbanak-group-en.pdf
 by Autor

TeamViewer, but later, the attckers abandoned it.
Andromeda is used as the main trojan instead of Anunak.
https://www.group-ib.com/resources/threat-research/Anunak_APT_against_financial_institutions.pdf

Malware installs itself as a service to provide persistence and SYSTEM privileges. 
Creates the service “<ServiceName>Sys” where ServiceName is any existing service randomly chosen, with the first character deleted.  
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf 

A service is created, 'ADOBEUPDTOOL', which calls the AdobeUpdateManagementTool.vbs

Comment: Autor:

Trojan as a floating DLL in the user’s explorer.exe instance and uses Reflective DLL Injection
https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf

Modifies “termsrv.dll”, “csrsrv.dll, “msgina.dl” and “winlogon. exe” modules. • https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf     

Loads and overwrites .dll responsible for passwords policy.  New .dll location points to «Notification Packages» [HKLM\ System\ CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa] registry key. 
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf     
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

The original file created by the exploit payload is then deleted.
And has a command to delete files.
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

Attackers deleted a series of documents and folders https://www.bitdefender.com/files/News/CaseStudies/study/262/Bitdefender-WhitePaper-An-APT-Blueprint-Gaining-New-Visibility-into-Financial-Threats-interactive.pdf

 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Malicious attachments delivered via spearphishing emails.
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

The malware drops a Shockwave Flash icon and, in other cases, VBE file is dropped and executes a second layer VBScript. https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https:/www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

Exploit attachments delivering MSIL/JScript Downloader and in other cases, the document downloads Spy.Sekur payload from hxxp://154.16.138[.]74/sexit.exe https://www.proofpoint.com/sites/default/files/proofpoint-threat-insight-carbanak-group-en.pdf




 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Scanning the network via WMI and PowerShell scripts invoking WMIC commands https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Carbanak sets the Termservice service execution mode to auto
https://www.cs.bu.edu/~goldbe/teaching/HW55815/presos/carbanak.pdf

Can remove Windows Service https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Execute a helper DLL when netsh.exe is executed. https://cyware.com/blog/carbanak-insights-into-the-billion-dollar-bank-security-threat-284d by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Carbanak copies itself into “%system32%\com” with the name “svchost.exe” https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf

The legitimate jusched.exe is replaced https://www.bitdefender.com/files/News/CaseStudies/study/262/Bitdefender-WhitePaper-An-APT-Blueprint-Gaining-New-Visibility-into-Financial-Threats-interactive.pdf

Install malware as Windows Service with Service Name of ‘WindowsCtlMonitor’  https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server 
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Network\LdrPath 
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Network\CLM
https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https://www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

Registry keys are created. HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Licenses. https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf

“HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\ SOFTWARE\Wincor Nixdorf\ProTopas\CurrentVersion\LYNXPAR\CASH_DISPENSER” https://www.group-ib.com/resources/threat-research/Anunak_APT_against_financial_institutions.pdf

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Notepad[USERNAME]\303F1428C3F https://www.bitdefender.com/files/News/CaseStudies/study/262/Bitdefender-WhitePaper-An-APT-Blueprint-Gaining-New-Visibility-into-Financial-Threats-interactive.pdf
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\AdobeUpdateManagementTool
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\c_last 
https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https:/www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\mshta https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Messages for the pseudo-HTTP protocol are delimited with the ‘|’ character. Or using ‘/’ in other cases. https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2017/06/behind-the-carbanak-backdoor.html

Combination of base64 and integer-ed characters (chr) to hide malicious code. https://web.archive.org/web/20180313145839/https:/www.trustwave.com/Resources/SpiderLabs-Blog/New-Carbanak-/-Anunak-Attack-Methodology/

XOR with the key of 0x41 https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf

Uso de métodos como split(), replace() y rand para generar obfuscación 
https://github.com/Aekras1a/Updated-Carbanak-Source-with-Plugins
 by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

Command killos: Puts in «ImagePath» registry [HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\
services\ACPI], [HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet002\services\ACPI]
and [HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\ACPI] bad data.
https://media.kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/03/08064518/Carbanak_APT_eng.pdf by Autor

metadata.name: -Technique comment
metadata.value:
Comment: Autor:

The Carberp DLL hasanti-analysis features that check for virtualization and common sandboxing techniques, exiting if it finds any. 
https://www.rsa.com/content/dam/en/white-paper/the-carbanak-fin7-syndicate.pdf by Autor
